pages.text: The $(item)Refinery/$ is a multiblock machine which uses $(l:base_concepts/heat)heat/$ to refine $(l:base_concepts/oil)Oil/$ into various fuels. It starts to work at 100°C. The higher the temperature applied, the faster it refines. The fuels that can be produced are, sorted from lightest to heaviest:$(li)$(thing)LPG (Liquefied Petroleum Gas)/$$(li)$(thing)Gasoline/$$(li)$(thing)Kerosene/$$(li)$(thing)Diesel/$

The $(thing)Refinery/$ is a multiblock structure: place down a $(item)Refinery Controller/$, then stack 2-4 $(item)Refinery Outputs/$ on top of or beside the Controller. $(p)Different multiblock sizes give different yields; given 10mB of oil as input:$(p)$(bold)2 Outputs/$$(br)$(li)$(thing)LPG/$ (2mB)$(li)$(thing)Diesel/$ (4mB)$(br)$(bold)3 Outputs/$$(li)$(thing)LPG/$ (2mB)$(li)$(thing)Kerosene/$ (3mB)$(li)$(thing)Diesel/$ (2mB)

$(bold)4 Outputs/$$(br)$(li)$(thing)LPG/$ (2mB)$(li)$(thing)Gasoline/$ (3mB)$(li)$(thing)Kerosene/$ (3mB)$(li)$(thing)Diesel/$ (2mB)$(p)The lightest fuel will always end up in the top $(item)Refinery Output/$, the heaviest in the bottom.  If you add more $(item)Refinery Outputs/$ to an existing stack, the multiblock will do its best to automatically rearrange any existing output liquids into their correct block, to keep the system running.

所有產出的流體可以作為$(l:compressors/liquid_compressor)流體壓縮機/$的燃料（其中輕燃料更好）。$(p)但是，還有兩個很重要的用途：$(li)$(thing)液化石油氣/$用於合成液態$(l:components/plastic)塑膠/$$(li)$(thing)柴油/$用於合成$(l:components/lubricant)潤滑油/$，在$(l:base_concepts/upgrades#speed)速度升級$中用到。$(p)上述兩個合成在$(l:manufacturing/thermopneumatic_processing_plant)熱氣動加工機/$中進行。

pages.title: 比較器支持
pages.text: $(item)精煉廠/$可以被$(item)比較器/$檢測：當$(item)精煉廠/$可以工作時比較器輸出信號 15，否則輸出信號 0。當有$(thing)石油/$可供精煉$(italic)且/$有空間輸出產物，精煉廠被認為可以工作。

pages.title: 構建提示
pages.text: Since the $(item)Refinery/$ is a multiblock with many faces exposed to the air, it can lose $(l:base_concepts/heat)Heat/$ quite rapidly if not well insulated. Therefore, it's strongly recommended to cover all unused faces of the multiblock to maximize efficiency. Note that any non-heat-conducting blocks can be used, including semi-solid blocks like $(item)slabs/$ or $(item)trapdoors/$, but $(l:machine/thermal_lagging)Thermal Lagging/$ is especially recommended.

You can use a $(l:machines/vortex_tube)Vortex Tube/$ to heat the  $(item)Refinery/$, or place hot fluids (Lava...) or blocks (Magma...) next to any $(item)Refinery/$ blocks.  Note that such fluids and blocks will get used up (their heat gets drained), so you may wish to find a way to automate the production and placement of those resources.
